title: Inflation Is Likely to Fuel Discussion as Fed Officials Meet
summary: Concerns about recession have faded. Federal Reserve officials meet this week more confident that the economy has shaken off recession worries that sent markets reeling late last year, but they face a new quandary about slowing inflation.

title: Ford Workers Question Auto Maker's Path to Turnaround
summary: Results of internal survey, taken before last week's earnings report, follow layoffs and drop in stock price. Nearly two years into Chief Executive Jim Hackett's turnaround plan, more Ford Motor Co. workers are feeling unsure about the company's strategy and looking for clearer communication from the auto maker's leadership team, according to employee-survey results circulated internally and reviewed by The Wall Street Journal.

title: Anki, Maker of Robotic Companion Cozmo, Lays Off Its Staff
summary: Startup raised some $200 million in venture funding but was unable to secure another deal. Anki Inc., the maker of the Cozmo robotic toy and AI-powered home assistants, has laid off its staff of about 200 people, saying its business is no longer feasible after it was unable to secure new funding.

title: Pentagon Approves More Troops for Southern Border
summary: Order includes Defense Department waiver to allow them to come into direct contact with migrants, asylum seekers. The Pentagon has approved a request from the Department of Homeland Security for 320 additional U.S. troops at the southern border, and has approved expanded authorities that allow them to come into direct contact with migrants and asylum seekers, defense officials said.

title: Heroism at the Synagogue
summary: The best defense against a killer with a gun is a defender with a gun.. When a gunman filled with anti-Semitism opened fire Saturday at a synagogue in Poway, Calif., worshipers turned into heroes. Sixty-year-old Lori Kaye was killed after jumping between Rabbi Yisroel Goldstein and the attacker, according to witnesses. Others shielded nearby children or hurried them to safety. Rabbi Goldstein, who was shot in the hands and lost his right index finger, wrapped his bloody wounds in a prayer shawl and rallied his congregation outside.

title: House Democrats, Trump Gird for Battle Over Subpoenas
summary: President vows to 'fight all the subpoenas' as Democrats seek unredacted Mueller report and testimony from administration officials. WASHINGTON-With President Trump vowing to "fight all the subpoenas," the Democratic-led House of Representatives is gearing up for a protracted legal battle over its power to enforce demands for documents and testimony from the administration.

title: Bronx Councilman King Faces Second Ethics Investigation
summary: Andy King under scrutiny for allegedly misusing funds, involving wife in council activity; claims follow earlier sexual-harassment violation. The New York City Council is investigating violations against Councilman Andy King for allegedly misusing city funds and letting his wife work on council business, the second investigation for the councilman who was disciplined last year for sexual harassment.

title: Florida's Eye of the Lawsuit Storm
summary: Republicans move to limit a proliferating insurance scam.. A storm surge of litigation against insurers has doused Florida homeowners who pay among the nation's highest home insurance premiums. But Floridians may soon get relief if Gov. Ron DeSantis signs legislation curtailing a longstanding legal abuse by plaintiff attorneys.

title: The Spanish Divide
summary: Voters rewarded parties that offered ideological competition.. Journalistic convention describes politics in the West these days as populists versus elites, but it is as much warmed-over centrism versus ideological competition. The notable feature of Spain's election Sunday is that voters rewarded the parties that delivered competition, for better or worse.

title: Index Firm MSCI Names Former Moody's Finance Chief as CFO
summary: Linda Huber succeeds interim CFO Andrew Wiechmann, who will become the index provider's first chief strategy officer. Index provider MSCI Inc. said Linda Huber will become its chief financial officer and treasurer next month.

title: Biden Makes Appeal to Blue-Collar Workers
summary: Former vice president kicks off campaign in Pittsburgh, vowing to advocate for middle-class families. PITTSBURGH-Joe Biden made a direct appeal to blue-collar workers in his first public appearance as a 2020 presidential candidate.

title: Stung by Trump's Criticisms of Russian Gas Deal, Germany Makes Its Own Threats
summary: Berlin pushes back after scathing criticism over close energy links to Russia. BERLIN-Germany pushed back against pressure from President Trump over its planned Russian gas pipeline after Berlin warned it could reconsider its commitment to begin importing American gas if the U.S. makes good on a threat to block the project.

title: WeWork Builds Real-Estate IPO on Tech Foundation
summary: Jumping on the Silicon Valley offering bandwagon doesn't mean the office-sharing real-estate giant deserves a tech-like multiple. WeWork is building off a tech-IPO foundation. The office-sharing real-estate giant has filed confidentially for an initial public offering, following Lyft , Uber Technologies, Slack Technologies and Zoom Video Communications in a rush to the public market. The New York-based company may be hoping to fetch a tech-like valuation in the wake of other recent initial public offerings.

title: Man Arrested for Allegedly Planning to Bomb White Nationalist Rally in Southern California
summary: Mark Steven Domingo accused of seeking revenge for attacks on Muslims, including New Zealand mosque shooting. LOS ANGELES-A former U.S. Army infantryman was arrested for allegedly plotting to bomb a white nationalist rally in Long Beach, Calif., as revenge for attacks against Muslims, federal authorities said.

title: Can China Dislodge Russia in Central Asia?
summary: In one former Soviet republic, Beijing's blandishments get it only so far.. Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan

title: When G-Men Run Amok
summary: The FBI's Trump-Russia investigation should have raised red flags.. Scarcely two weeks after the Mueller report dropped, it isn't clear how the Russia collusion story ends. Will it be limited to the central finding of the report, confirming that Donald Trump and his campaign did not conspire with Russians? Or might it turn out to be something more ironic-for example, criminal prosecution of Justice Department and FBI officials who led us down the collusion path?

title: Marriott to Take On Airbnb in Booming Home-Rental Market
summary: Company poised to be the first major hotel company to create a U.S. home-rental platform. Marriott International Inc. is starting a new home-rental business, aiming to take on Airbnb Inc. and other home-sharing companies in one of the lodging industry's hottest segments.

title: When Reagan Went to China
summary: If only Beijing had listened when he delivered a tribute to American individualism at a Shanghai university.. I recently suggested to a still-sprightly friend who worked in the Reagan White House that President Reagan's address at Fudan University in Shanghai-delivered April 30, 1984-was a terrific speech that stands forgotten. My friend texted a pensive reply. "If not largely forgotten, then it's at least overshadowed by subsequent oratory in a busy rhetorical era."

title: The Madness of Nuclear Deterrence
summary: The dangers have only become more acute in the decades since I tried to convince Thatcher.. 'Deterrence cannot protect the world from a nuclear blunder or nuclear terrorism," George Shultz, William Perry and Sam Nunn recently wrote. "Both become more likely when there is no sustained, meaningful dialogue between Washington and Moscow." I agree with them about the urgent need for strategic engagement between the U.S. and Russia. I am also convinced that nuclear deterrence, instead of protecting the world, is keeping it in constant jeopardy.

title: Cryptocurrency Investors Shrug Off Tether Woes
summary: Allegations raised Thursday surrounding popular digital coin haven't had much effect on trading. A pillar of the young cryptocurrency market is wobbling following allegations from the New York Attorney General's office that the dollar reserves backing popular digital coin tether have been compromised. Investors don't seem too concerned.

title: The Prosecutor Who Can't Make Up Her Mind
summary: Kamala Harris reverses herself surprisingly often on matters at the core of her professional life.. Should the surviving Boston Marathon bomber be allowed to vote from prison? It sounds like an easy question, but it wasn't for California Sen. Kamala Harris at a CNN town hall April 22. "I have been long an advocate of making sure that the formerly incarcerated are not denied a right to vote," she answered. When host Don Lemon tried to pin her down on whether Dzhokhar Tsarnaev should be allowed to vote, she said: "I think we should have that conversation."

title: The Party of Buttigieg and Sharpton
summary: The mayor seeks the blessing of a dubious Democratic elder.. While Joe Biden is being held to account for things he said and did as long ago as the 1970s, Mayor Pete Buttigieg had lunch in Harlem Monday, seeking the blessing of the Rev. Al Sharpton.

title: 'Late Bloomers' Review: Please Don't Rush Me
summary: Our culture exalts youthful brilliance over mature achievement. Talent often flourishes later in life, when experience brings wisdom.. It's a nice idea that success can come at any point in life. You don't have to be Mark Zuckerberg, vaulting up the rich-list rankings in his 20s, or Pete Buttigieg, running for president at 37. You can wait until you are more evolved and take what Rich Karlgaard calls, in "Late Bloomers," the "slower walk of discovery."

title: Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein Submits Resignation
summary: Rosenstein will leave May 11, ending a tumultuous two years as Justice Department's No. 2 official. Deputy Attorney General Rod Rosenstein submitted his resignation letter to President Trump on Monday, ending a tumultuous two years in which he tried to steady a rocky Justice Department and its relationship with the White House.

title: WeWork Files for Initial Public Offering
summary: The shared-office-space giant filed confidentially with the SEC in December; WeWork was last valued at $47 billion. Shared-office-space giant WeWork Cos. has added its name to the slew of highly valued startups heading to the public markets, a surprise move that will test the company's rich valuation and heavy spending.

title: Online Pet Products Retailer Chewy Files for IPO
summary: Company says it plans on using proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes. Chewy Inc. the online seller of branded and private-label pet food and grooming supplies, has filed documents to pursue an initial public offering.

title: Anadarko to Resume Talks With Occidental on Buyout Bid
summary: Decision sets stage for bidding war between Occidental and Chevron for oil driller. Anadarko Petroleum Corp. said it was considering Occidental Petroleum Corp.'s $38 billion offer, weeks after agreeing to be taken over by Chevron Corp. for about $33 billion, the latest development in a tug of war over prized assets in the heart of the U.S. fracking boom.

title: Measles Outbreak Worsens, Tops Last Week's 25-Year High
summary: Outbreak shows no sign of slowing with 78 new cases in the past week. The measles outbreak in the U.S. shows no signs of abating, as it topped the 25-year high it set last week with at least 704 cases now in 22 states since the beginning of this year, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported.

title: Spotify Narrows Loss, Hits 100 Million Subscribers
summary: The music-streaming giant posted a first-quarter loss of $158 million and a small slip in average revenue per user. Spotify Technology SA narrowed its loss in the most recent quarter as the music-streaming giant invested heavily in its growing podcast business and said it now has 100 million paying users.

title: Dollar Edges Lower Ahead of Fed, Jobs Report
summary: More signs of strength are likely to push the greenback higher, analysts say. The dollar edged lower Monday ahead of two key events later this week: the Federal Reserve's monetary policy statement and the U.S. employment report.

title: CNN and Avenatti
summary: The network is applauded by the press corps while a favorite guest pleads not guilty.. One of CNN's most frequent guests was in court today fighting another round of criminal charges. Over the weekend the cable news network was honored for its coverage of a controversy he helped to inflame.

title: Inflation Picks Up, but Still Below Fed's 2% Target
summary: Slow price growth in March comes despite strong economy, adding to central bank's unease. WASHINGTON-Inflation remained well below the Federal Reserve's 2% target in March even though consumer spending surged, as trade and technological innovation likely weighed on prices for many goods.

title: Regulator Scrutinizes Trades Before Anadarko Deal Announcement
summary: The traders purchased 1,650 call options in the weeks before news that Chevron would acquire Anadarko became public, then exercised the call options days after the news. Traders used insider information to turn a profit of about $2.5 million related to the sale of Anadarko Petroleum Corp. , according to the Securities and Exchange Commission on Monday.

title: Consumer Group Seeks Probe of NIH
summary: Public Citizen calls for investigation into health agency's barring researchers from sharing concerns about sepsis study. A consumer group wants to know why the National Institutes of Health prevented two doctors critical of a sepsis trial from speaking to U.S. investigators.

title: 'Father of the Bride' by Vampire Weekend Review: Much to Be Proud Of
summary: The indie group returns after a six-year hiatus with a lengthy album worth the wait..

title: Trump Says NRA 'Under Siege' by New York State
summary: N.Y. attorney general has opened a probe into the gun-rights group over potential financial and disclosure problems. WASHINGTON-President Trump on Monday said the National Rifle Association was "under siege" by the New York attorney general, which is investigating potential financial and disclosure problems at the organization amid internal turmoil in its top ranks.

title: FedEx CIO Looks to Industry Collaboration to Scale Blockchain
summary: Technology is expected to smooth the way shipments are delivered, though the speed at which this happens depends on how well various companies work together. Blockchain is expected within a few years to become an "inevitable and essential" tool in tracking goods and reducing fraud in the supply chain, said FedEx Corp.'s chief information officer-but widespread collaboration will be needed for the technology to really take off.

title: Democrats Push for Expansive Infrastructure Package
summary: Ahead of meeting with Trump on potential bipartisan deal, Pelosi and Schumer call for inclusion of environmental, revenue provisions. WASHINGTON-Congressional Democratic leaders laid down a marker ahead of a meeting with President Trump to discuss a bipartisan compromise on infrastructure, calling for a package that also would address climate change and include new revenue. But they didn't discuss the thorniest issue: Where will the new revenue come from?

title: Sales Cool for Parent Company of Tim Hortons and Burger King
summary: Restaurant Brands chief executive says competition is intense; 'We are fighting for share'. Restaurant Brands International Inc. reported profit and same-store sales growth that were lower than expected in the first quarter, pushing down shares in the owner of Burger King and Tim Hortons.

title: 'Avengers: Endgame' Also a Wall Street Hit
summary: Shares of Disney reach intraday record as analysts raise estimates for quarterly earnings. LOS ANGELES-Walt Disney Co. 's superheroes brought some of their power to Wall Street, even if it was fleeting.

title: ISIS Video Purports to Show Baghdadi, Extremist Group's Leader
summary: In video released by extremist group, figure said to be Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi praises Sri Lanka attackers. Islamic State released a rare recorded video that purports to show its leader, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, following the complete collapse of the extremist group's self-declared caliphate last month when its last outpost in Syria was captured.

title: Workers Finding Clients Through Online Platforms Aren't Employees, Labor Department Says
summary: People getting work through 'virtual marketplace' companies such as Angie's List are contractors, the Trump administration says in a letter. Workers lining up jobs through smartphone apps and websites such as Handy and Angie's List are independent contractors and not employees of those platforms, the Labor Department said in a letter Monday.

title: John Singleton, 'Boyz N the Hood' Director, Dies at 51
summary: Filmmaker brought African-American stories of the inner city into the center of Hollywood. John Singleton, the filmmaker who brought African-American stories of the inner city into the center of Hollywood and popular culture with movies such as "Boyz N the Hood" and "Poetic Justice," died on Monday at age 51. He had struggled with hypertension and suffered a stroke earlier this month, according to a statement from his family.

title: A Revolutionary 'Otello'
summary: A rare black tenor to be cast in the part, Russell Thomas imbues Otello with vocal and psychological nuance.. Toronto

title: U.S. Stocks Rise, Bolstered by Data
summary: Consumer spending rose in February and March, while inflation remained muted. U.S. stocks edged up to fresh closing records Monday after data showed the economy was on solid footing in the first three months of the year.

title: Boeing Suppliers Seek to Manage Uncertainty as 737 MAX Remains Grounded
summary: 'It is not an easy supply chain to switch on and off,' a parts maker says. Suppliers to Boeing Co. are struggling to navigate uncertainty arising from the continued grounding of the company's 737 MAX aircraft.

title: Treasurys Drop as Consumer Spending Rises
summary: New data suggest consumers got more confident as the first quarter progressed. U.S. government-bond prices fell after new data showed Americans revved up their spending last month.

title: Yext Moving Headquarters to Chelsea Building Abandoned by Aetna
summary: New York software developer to sublease office space, plans to create 500 new jobs. Yext Inc. on Monday said it will take over the New York City office that health insurer Aetna Inc. abandoned as its new headquarters after it agreed to be acquired by CVS Health Corp.

title: Former Abraaj Executive Mustafa Abdel-Wadood Granted Bail
summary: Abdel-Wadood, one of several former executives facing fraud charges, is to be transferred to house arrest while he awaits his trial. Mustafa Abdel-Wadood, one of several former Abraaj Group executives facing fraud charges in a widespread criminal case against the now-bankrupt private-equity firm, was granted bail with plans to be transferred to house arrest in New York.

title: Oil Prices Mixed as OPEC Considers Raising Output
summary: Prices fell nearly 3% Friday after President Trump called on OPEC to raise production. -Oil prices ended mixed Monday in tight-range trading as investors weighed the possibility that the world's main oil-producing nations may increase output to put a lid on prices that hit a six-month high last week.

title: Former Derivatives Regulator Bart Chilton Dies at 58
summary: As a Democratic commissioner on CFTC, he helped draft new rules for swaps trading following financial crisis. Bart Chilton, a former top derivatives regulator who criticized high-frequency trading but was bullish on the rise of cryptocurrencies, has died at the age of 58.

title: Bitcoin Venture Backed by NYSE Owner Faces Fresh Delay
summary: Bakkt's pursuit of trust status in New York state complicates its path to launch. A plan by the owner of the New York Stock Exchange to make it easier for consumers to pay for purchases in bitcoin faces further delays after the venture, called Bakkt, said it was applying for a license from New York state regulators.

title: Oil Volatility Puts 2019 Rally Under Scrutiny
summary: Portfolio managers move into less-risky investments; prices swing with Trump pressure on OPEC and Iran. Volatility is picking up in oil markets following a powerful 2019 rally, prompting a retreat among portfolio managers into less-risky investments in a sector that many investors still view as hot.

title: With Joe Biden's 2020 Announcement, Obama Legacy Becomes a Focus
summary: Former president is more popular than many Democrats, but some candidates suggest he didn't go far enough to the left. WASHINGTON-Joe Biden's entrance into the Democratic presidential race adds fuel to an intraparty debate over the legacy of President Barack Obama, whom he served in the White House for eight years as vice president.

title: Copper's Slide Signals Caution About Chinese Growth
summary: Many investors use the metal to gauge the momentum in the global economy. A slide in copper prices in recent days is causing investors to grow warier of a slowdown in Chinese economic growth, increasing their focus on coming trade talks.

title: Alibaba Agrees to Pay $250 Million to Resolve Complaints
summary: Company and executives named in suits deny all allegations of wrongdoing or liability. Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. has agreed to pay $250 million to resolve investors' lawsuits that accused the company of not disclosing before its $25 billion initial public offering that officials had met with the Chinese government regarding alleged counterfeit products sold on its platforms.

title: Segregation by Design on Campus
summary: How racial separatism become the norm at elite universities like Yale, Brown and Wesleyan.. In his inaugural address in January 1963, Gov. George Wallace of Alabama thundered: "Segregation now, segregation tomorrow, and segregation forever." About "tomorrow," Wallace was right. More than half a century later, racial segregation comes as easy as breathing to many American colleges and universities.

title: Low Marks for Warren's College-Debt Plan
summary: Under the senator's proposal would I have been better off not funding my son's 529 plan, loading him up with debt and simply agreeing to make the monthly payments until the government forgives the loan?. Regarding your editorial "Warren's Free College Time Machine" (April 25): As many have correctly pointed out, Sen. Elizabeth Warren's college-debt forgiveness proposal has many flaws. However, if I'm being pragmatic and forward thinking, I should examine the impact on my own financial planning if such a proposal were to pass. I have a son at a private college with an annual cost of approximately $70,000. I believe this is a good investment, and I planned appropriately over the past 18 years. Under the senator's proposal would I have been better off not funding my son's 529 plan, keeping these savings in my own name, loading him up with debt and simply agreeing to make the monthly payments until the government forgives the loan? You can bet that many will look to game the system. If enacted, this proposal will soon become a runaway train. Yes, college is expensive and, yes, some schools and degrees aren't worth the price. Caveat emptor.

title: NYU Is Committed to Its Jewish Community
summary: President Hamilton responds to a charge of anti-Semitism at the university.. Susan Shapiro's "Anti-Semitism at NYU" (op-ed, April 22) implies that New York University is tolerant of anti-Semitism. The sting of this piece is not in its allegations, but in its falsehoods and half-truths. The real record is far different.

title: Comparing U.S. and Canadian Health Data
summary: Regarding a male life expectancy of 76.4 years in the U.S. compared with 79.4 in Canada: Perhaps our homicide rate, our deaths due to drug overdoses, a sedentary lifestyle and obesity should be addressed. These are societal issues, not deficiencies in our health-care system.. Elliott Kanbar's letter of April 24 points out that Canada's infant mortality and life expectancy rates are superior to ours. Many countries don't follow the U.N.'s definition of a live birth. In Canada, babies must be at least one pound to be counted as a live birth. Likewise, Switzerland, Austria, Germany, France, Japan and Hong Kong count as miscarriages many births that the U.S. considers as live births. Excluding birth defects, the main causes of infant mortality are prematurity and low birth weight, which are usually due to smoking and teenage pregnancy.

title: The Progressive Approach To the Democratic Debates
summary: The top 1% of candidates could be required to share their debate time (and campaign contributions) with those at the bottom.. I hope Sean M. Spicer's "The Democrats' Debate Debacle" (op-ed, April 23) inspires the Democratic National Committee to try a more fitting way to manage its presidential debates. Why not apply the DNC's economic philosophy to the debates?

title: Gold Drops After Upbeat Consumer Spending Data
summary: Confidence in U.S. economic growth has hurt gold by boosting stocks and other risk assets. Gold prices fell Monday, pulling back after data showed U.S. consumer spending picked up in March.

title: Boeing Chief Defends 737 MAX Design Work
summary: Dennis Muilenburg calls jet's development 'thorough;' shareholders reject splitting CEO, chairman jobs. CHICAGO- Boeing Co. Chief Executive Dennis Muilenburg rejected criticism of how the plane maker designed a 737 MAX flight-control system that accident investigators have implicated in two fatal crashes of the jetliner.

title: India Raids Homes Allegedly Linked to Islamic State
summary: Move comes a week after deadly attacks in neighboring Sri Lanka that investigators think were backed by the militant group. NEW DELHI-Indian authorities searched three locations allegedly linked to Islamic State recruitment, a week after deadly Easter attacks in neighboring Sri Lanka that investigators think were backed by the militant group.

title: On the Trail of Pioneers in the Nation's Westward Push
summary: Pulitzer Prize winner David McCullough delves into the less familiar story of the settlement of the Northwest Territory in his new book. More than 200 years after settlers embarked on a 700-mile journey from New England to what was known as the Northwest Territory, David McCullough says a crucial item on their packing list is also on his: books.

title: End of Oil Waivers Pushes Price Forecasts Higher
summary: Investment banks now expect Brent crude to average nearly $70 a barrel in 2019. LONDON-Investment banks in April raised their forecasts for this year's oil prices, driven by a U.S. decision to tighten sanctions on Iran's oil industry, as well as OPEC-led production cuts.

title: Boeing's 737 MAX Is Too Big to Fail
summary: Production cuts at Boeing will likely hit GDP growth this quarter, showcasing its economic heft even as complaints mount. The 737 MAX airplane isn't just important for Boeing , it also matters for airlines and even the U.S. economy. This puts the plane maker in a position of power, even as complaints mount about how the company handled safety issues.

title: Transcript: WSJ Interview With Fed Candidate Stephen Moore
summary: Conservative commentator discusses the chances President Trump will nominate him and the Senate will confirm him for a Fed seat. Conservative commentator Stephen Moore sat down Wednesday, April 24, 2019, for an interview with The Wall Street Journal to discuss the chances President Trump will nominate him and the Senate will confirm him for a seat on the Federal Reserve Board of Governors. Mr. Trump said last month he intended to nominate Mr. Moore for the position before his former campaign adviser had gone through the extensive background checks traditionally conducted before such a formal announcement. Mr. Moore said he is hopeful he will be nominated and confirmed, but would bow out of the process if he became a political liability for the administration or Senate Republicans. The Journal's Paul Kiernan conducted the interview. Here are excerpts from the exchange, edited for length and clarity, organized by topic.

title: America's Aging Bridge Clubs Find Themselves Holding a Tough Hand
summary: As players shift online or age out, it's growing harder to find younger replacements to host home games; 'cheaper than therapy'. MT. LEBANON, Pa.-Once a month, the women of the Mt. Lebanon Bridge Group, ages 66 to 78, gather in one another's homes for cards and chatter.

title: Foxconn Tore Up a Small Town to Build a Big Factory-Then Retreated
summary: The iPhone maker got fat incentives to build a $10 billion LCD plant that largely hasn't materialized on land where Mount Pleasant, Wis., razed homes and crops. MOUNT PLEASANT, Wis.-Six miles west of Lake Michigan lies a cleared building site half again as big as Central Park, ready for Foxconn Technology Group's $10 billion liquid-crystal-display factory.

title: Phillips Auction House Hires Former Sotheby's Rainmaker
summary: Boutique auction house Phillips hires Sotheby's alum David Norman to compete with larger rivals for market-moving sales. Phillips, a boutique auction house known for selling edgy contemporary art, said Monday it hired a former Sotheby's rainmaker to bolster its chances of selling modern masters.

title: Elaborate Los Angeles Spec Mansion Asks $46.5 Million
summary: Built by a partnership that includes British billionaires Ian and Richard Livingstone, the roughly 24,000-square-foot home was built over a nearly three-year period.. An elaborate Los Angeles spec mansion is going on the market for $46.5 million.

title: Elaborate Los Angeles Spec Mansion Asks $46.5 Million
summary: Built by a partnership that includes British billionaires Ian and Richard Livingstone, the roughly 24,000-square-foot home was built over a nearly three-year period.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Manhattan Home of Socialite Lee Radziwill Lists for $5.7 Million
summary: The fashion icon and younger sister of Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis died in February at age 85.. The Manhattan home of Lee Radziwill, a prominent New York socialite and the younger sister of Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis, is listing for $5.7 million.

title: Why Non-Runners are Obsessed with These Running Shoes
summary: Sturdy-soled trail running and performance sneakers by Salomon, Hoka One One and Asics have come into style of late. Totokaelo is not a store that caters to trail runners. The Seattle-based retailer is clearly targeting the fashion-obsessed-those more interested in seersucker trousers by French label Lemaire than skimpy Patagonia shorts that swish when you sprint. And yet, the shoe department of Totokaelo's downtown Manhattan outpost carries trail-running sneakers with sturdy soles and plenty of traction made by Salomon, a 74-year-old French outdoor brand. The shoes were devised for (and still mostly marketed to) people likely to race across rocks, yet here, they're sold to the most fastidious of urban errand runners.

title: A Growing Problem for Baseball's Biggest Prospect
summary: Vladimir Guerrero Jr. can hit, but the Blue Jays worry that his conditioning will hurt his defense, durability and long-term health. The first time Ismael Cruz watched Vladimir Guerrero Jr. play baseball as a teenager in the Dominican Republic, two things immediately stood out to him as a longtime scout: the way Guerrero hit-and the way Guerrero looked.

title: Privacy Experts Expect Amendments to Clarify, Restrict California Law
summary: A sweeping law set to take effect in 2020 was passed in haste, leading to confusion. Now the state legislature is working on tweaks to address shortcomings.. A sweeping California privacy law was passed in such haste last year that companies are confused about what exactly they need to do to comply. With about eight months to go until the law goes into effect, state lawmakers are proposing amendments to iron out some of the issues.

title: U.S. Would Rethink Intelligence Ties if Allies Use Huawei Technology
summary: European countries could lose access to U.S. intelligence if Chinese gear is used in new telecoms networks. The U.S. ratcheted up pressure on its European allies to ban Chinese-made gear from their telecom networks, asserting such equipment could be a shared national-security threat to the West and could compromise intelligence sharing.

title: Got Any Bright Ideas? Dia Needs a Lighting Fix for Its Famed Exhibit
summary: Art foundation faces dwindling supply of specialty bulbs to illuminate conceptual artist Walter De Maria's 'The Broken Kilometer'. One recent morning, John Sprague, the exhibition buildings manager at the Dia Art Foundation, climbed a 12-foot fiberglass ladder inside a capacious whitewashed gallery on West Broadway in Soho.

title: Dow 2400 Anyone?
summary: Likely Fed nominee Stephen Moore warns of 'biggest selloff in the stock market in American history'. No, that headline isn't a typo.

title: Negative Yields Deepen Along With Europe's Problems
summary: The amount of negative-yielding government bonds outstanding through 2049 has risen by 20% this year. A growing number of investors are paying governments in Europe for the privilege of holding their bonds.

title: Mnuchin Suggests China Trade Talks Could Wrap Up by End of Next Week
summary: Treasury secretary will travel to China this week for further talks, adding that both sides are fine-tuning provisions that would ensure the deal is enforceable. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin suggested Monday that trade talks with China could be wrapped up by the end of next week, following two more rounds of negotiations.

title: Verizon Retirees Urge Change to Executive Pay
summary: Resume Subscription. An effort by former Verizon Communications Inc. employees to push for governance changes at the wireless carrier will face another test this week, highlighting the retirees' reputation as unlikely corporate activists.

title: The New Strategies for Raising a Boy
summary: A book offers a road map for parents of sons at a time when boys face struggles at school and increasing pressures on social media. It's a challenging time to parent a boy. Moms and dads worry about everything from hypermasculine cultural stereotypes to how to talk about sex in the #MeToo era.

title: Tesla Faces Steeper Costs to Raise Cash
summary: CEO Elon Musk reverses stance on raising capital, but car maker may have already missed the chance to do so cheaply. Tesla Inc. has plenty of options for raising money, but it is getting more expensive to do so.

title: Impeachment Could Be a Trap-for Democrats
summary: Everything about President Trump's history suggests he likes a clearly identifiable enemy, and he likes a fight. What if President Trump actually wants Democrats to try to impeach him?

title: Suspected U.A.E. Spy Found Dead in Turkish Jail
summary: Alleged operative was one of two men arrested for spying and was under investigation for possible links to the killing of Jamal Khashoggi. ISTANBUL-One of two alleged spies for the United Arab Emirates, who was also under investigation for a possible link to the killing of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, has been found dead inside his Turkish jail cell.

title: Stocks to Watch: Tesla, Loews, Spotify, Gardner Denver, Boeing, Anadarko and More
summary: Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively Monday. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Monday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours; premarket trading is specified separately.

title: She Invented the Vampire Facial. Now Her Business Has Exploded
summary: She's treated Gwyneth Paltrow, Angela Bassett and at least one Hadid. How Dr. Barbara Sturm, 47, has grown her skincare business 300 percent over the last two years-entirely on word of mouth. Dr. Barbara Sturm, the founder and CEO of her eponymous skin-care brand, has an itinerary that would make any frequent flier dizzy. She often visits five different countries in a month. It's all in support of Dr. Barbara Sturm Molecular Cosmetics, which she launched in 2003. In 2006, she opened a clinic near her home in Düsseldorf, Germany. Thanks in part to a fan base that includes Bella Hadid, Angela Bassett and Gwyneth Paltrow, and the buzz surrounding what's known as her Vampire Facial (a treatment that involves injecting the client's own blood proteins back into the skin), sales have increased 300 percent over each of the past two years-without any advertising. "I think product gets transported best through word of mouth," says Sturm, 47.

title: Tracking Barbara Sturm
summary: A day in the life of the beauty mogul. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Why Lisa Kudrow Doesn't Work Out
summary: Booksmart star Kudrow and five other luminaries and notables holding forth on this months' topic: wellness. See what screenwriter Dustin Lance Black, Warby Parker co-CEO Dave Gilboa and more have to say on the topic. "Los Angeles is really [health oriented]; I've definitely found that stereotype to be true. I've tried working out with trainers and, listen, it hurts. My philosophy is that the pain response is a message from your body to just stop. I'm not anti-exercise-you have to move-but I like walking. When you're walking with friends you get to talk, and that's really important [for wellness]. My family has also been a touchstone for me. I'm so appreciative of fans, but they're not my day-to-day reflection of myself. I'm on the board of advisors of the UCLA Resnick Neuropsychiatric Hospital, and through that I learn a lot. Mental health is a part of your whole health. We need to get rid of the stigma around it. There is more awareness, and part of that is thanks to younger people. They're talking about it very openly. The worst thing is to keep it quiet; then it's very hard to get help."

title: U.S. Consumer Spending Rises in February, March
summary: Measure of household spending increased 0.1% in February and 0.9% in March. WASHINGTON-U.S. consumers picked up their spending in February and March, a sign that households were feeling confident about their economic prospects.

title: In New York, L Train Tunnel Repair Brings Long Waits but Few Hiccups
summary: Service is reduced on nights and weekends to accommodate construction, which will last about one year. The first weekend of reduced service on the L subway line passed relatively uneventfully as New York's Metropolitan Transportation Authority began the main phase of repairs to an East River tunnel.

title: Can an Extra $333 a Month Improve a Baby's Brain?
summary: Study aims to discover whether reducing poverty can make a positive difference in babies' cognitive and emotional development. Kimberly Noble, a neuroscientist, holds up a blue and red cap dotted with electrodes that rest on a toddler's scalp to measure electrical activity in the brain.

title: A Rookie Sports Parent's Guide to Sports Parenting
summary: A columnist enters the magical world of practices, game days, and cheese sticks. So far, so good-but it's early. I've recently become a bona fide sports parent. I think it's going fine. I've yet to get arrested for sumo-wrestling another parent in the parking lot. Of course, there's plenty of season left, so who knows.

title: Slack Can Make the Stretch
summary: A low cash-burn rate gives messaging platform plenty of time. It is unclear why Slack Technologies is choosing to forgo a traditional initial public offering. What is clear is that the corporate-communications platform doesn't need the money.

title: Nuclear-Bailout Bills in Pennsylvania, Ohio Face Growing Opposition
summary: Supporters say plants provide zero-emission power; consumers, industry groups decry price tag. Bills in Pennsylvania and Ohio to prop up troubled nuclear-power plants face growing opposition from businesses and advocacy groups, who say the plans are too costly and would unfairly tip the scales in energy markets.

title: To Make a Comeback, Europe's Center-Left Is Leaning More...Left
summary: Move paid dividends in Spanish elections, where Socialists trounced conservative rivals in fragmented field. Europe's center-left parties, faced with falling support, are shifting left to win back working-class voters lost to hard-left and populist movements-a move that paid off in Spain's national elections on Sunday, where the Socialists trounced their conservative rivals.

title: Alphabet Investors Search for Clues Inside Tech Giant
summary: Questions abound about future growth of the wildly profitable Google parent. Google parent Alphabet Inc. is scheduled to announce first-quarter earnings after the market closes on Monday. Here is what you need to know:

title: The NBA's Catch Rule Controversy
summary: Nobody can agree whether James Harden is getting fouled-and these calls could decide the Rockets vs. Warriors series. It was a close game at the beginning of what could be another epic series between two of the best teams in the NBA, and yet the only thing on anybody's mind after the Golden State Warriors beat the Houston Rockets was a question that nobody knew how to answer.

title: China's Recovery Isn't What You Think
summary: Resume Subscription. The skies are clearing for investors in China, but it's still best to keep your umbrella handy.

title: Women Wanted: Blue-Collar Fields Find New Workforce
summary: Resume Subscription. Kenyette Godhigh-Bell dismissed any thought of becoming a truck driver years ago when it appeared too daunting to break into a job where more than 90% of workers are men.

title: The Most Aggravating Smartphone Sins at the Gym
summary: Fitness centers want happy customers posting photos on social media, but as sharing becomes more common, so do breaches of etiquette. Most gym-goers can agree on basic gym etiquette: If you sweat on it, wipe it down. Don't hog equipment. Rack your weights. But what about selfies?

title: Energy Project Opponents Take Top Environmental Award
summary: Four of this year's six Goldman Environmental Prize winners fought against projects including dams and a rail terminal. SAN FRANCISCO-Activists who helped block major energy-related development efforts on four continents dominate this year's Goldman Environmental Prizes, the highest honors in its field.

title: How One Bookstore Succeeds in the Amazon Age
summary: A Cappella Books has survived, even thrived, the same way other indie bookstores have: by rethinking the way it makes money. Frank Reiss's business spent 10 years on the edge of collapse.

title: What Teenagers Learn When They Start a Business
summary: The real benefits may not be the money they make, but the lessons about startups-and life. For teenage entrepreneurs, running a summer business can teach a lot of lessons.

title: What Happens When Entrepreneurs Go on Vacation-and a Crisis Hits
summary: Some business owners dare to leave the office behind. Way behind. Here are three who lived to tell about it.. For entrepreneurs, dealing with a work crisis on vacation comes with the territory.

title: A Generation of Siblings, Raised to Be Entrepreneurs
summary: For the Burch clan, instilling enthusiasm for startups has been a lifelong project-starting pretty much from birth. Bob Burch has been immersing his children in entrepreneurship for their whole lives. Just about literally.

title: Small Businesses Turn to Augmented Reality to Woo Customers
summary: Startups are discovering that the new technology can help cut costs and give them an edge on big rivals.. Imagine using your phone to move a couch around your living room. Or put false eyelashes on your face. Or open a wedding cake to see the filling

title: Entrepreneurs Are Better Off Going It Alone, Study Says
summary: Startups founded by a single person are more likely to survive and succeed than those founded by a team. Entrepreneurs who go it alone stand a lot better chance of surviving-and succeeding-than those who team up.

title: Why Round Numbers Can Hurt Crowdfunding Campaigns
summary: Goals with round amounts do worse than others, researchers say. Round numbers are handy-they're easy to add, subtract and remember. But they're not so helpful when it comes to crowdfunding.

title: His Grandfather Needed a New Kind of Coffee Cup. A Business Was Born
summary: The Arseneaus looked to create a mug that was easier for his aging grandfather to handle-and found a successful idea. Seeing a grandfather struggle made a couple wonder how they could help him. And it made them realize they could build a business, too.

title: Synagogue Congregants Tell of Quick Action to Save Children
summary: Shooter abruptly halted fire: 'He may have been trying to change a magazine, or he just panicked'. POWAY, Calif.-Oscar Stewart was sitting in the back of the Chabad of Poway synagogue when he heard the gunshots, some 20 minutes after 11 a.m. services began on Saturday. He said his first reaction was to run and he sprinted out into the entryway-where he saw the gunman, firing an AR-style rifle down the hallway.
